intro: Anneslia rekoi, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Anneslia rekoi typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
